Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [drives up to the entrance of the building, his license plate reads "NEW MGR"] It's a beautiful morning at Dunder-Mifflin, or as I like to call it, Great Bratton. [gets out of car, tosses his keys toward a nonexistent valet parker] Keep it running.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Do I love being manager?... I love my kids. I love real estate. [slowly getting more excited] I love ceramics. I love my job. I-I love wrestling.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [to Jordan] Find out what language this is. [speaking in strange language]

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [running a meeting in the conference room] Okay, team building! On this side of the room, Stanley, Phyllis, Jim, Ted, Elroy, [camera switches to show only Meredith and Kevin have attended the meeting, Jim walks by and sees this] and this side of the room, Pam, Meredith, Phyllis, Creed...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He never called a meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [pointing at a whiteboard with BOBODDY written on the left side, vertically] BO-BODDY! BO-BODDY. What does the first "B" stand for?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What are we doing?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: We're making acronyms. Okay! What does the first "B" stand for?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Um... Business!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I like it! Business! Good, Kevin! [writes after the first B, I, Z, N, U...] All right! The "O"...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We need a new manager.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [conducting interview] Your paper experience is very interesting. Do you think you could use that experience to inform decisions here?

Quote.Speaker: Fred Henry
Quote.Text: Absolutely-I, yes. In fact, I actually have a three-step plan that I believe could effectively double your profits.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Fred
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [waiting for Fred to continue] ...What is it?

Quote.Speaker: Fred
Quote.Text: Nice try.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, what is your three-step plan?

Quote.Speaker: Fred
Quote.Text: Well, I mean, I can't just hand you my plan. I mean, if you guys give me the job, then, then you'll get the plan.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Well... it's an interview, and we don't know that you really have the plan.

Quote.Speaker: Fred
Quote.Text: [speaking faster] Well, I'm not gonna just make up that I have a plan. I got a plan. Believe me, you guys want it. You're in paper, right?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: How would we know that, if you don't...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You could just be saying it to get the job.

Quote.Speaker: Fred
Quote.Text: I guess I could be, if I was... who would do that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How about this. Why don't you give us a part of the plan, and that way we know you have it.

Quote.Speaker: Fred
Quote.Text: Tell you what. I'll give you part three of part two. Not gonna give you a whole part.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Fred
Quote.Text: Color-code sent documents, TM.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did you just trademark that...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [confused] W-What?

Quote.Speaker: Fred
Quote.Text: That's a verbal trademark. That's an agreement.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We are the Search Committee, hand-picked by our CEO, and tasked to find this branch's new manager. Not everyone we meet will be good, but someone's bound to be, right? [Andy, Kelly, and Darryl are each dressed up in suits for their interviews, Andy is also wearing an "Andy for Manager?" pin on his jacket] And, to be honest, I think a lot of the decent candidates are right here in-house, so, I'm not too worried. But I'm really excited to spend a lot of time with Toby and Gabe. [quietly] Did you know that Gabe's last name was Lewis? I had no idea.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [in elevator with Phyllis and Darryl, all three are smiling, to Darryl] Good morning.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Good morning.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [also to Darryl] Good morning.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Good morning.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Did you have a nice drive in?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I did.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I have a solid relationship with Jo, the company's owner. I have management experience. I have a good friendship with Jim, the head of the Search Committee, and it doesn't hurt that I'm... [in Oprah-like sing-song voice] bla-aaack!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [puts up a poster in the break room with "IF YOU ARE ON THE SEARCH COMMITTEE PLEASE CONSIDER ANDY" on it in bold lettering]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [commenting on the poster] It's good. I really hope you get it!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: The manager job? Nah, I'm barely interested. I just can't not go for it. You know, it's not the Bernard way. We give it the old college try, and then, in defeat, we show grace.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Still, I'd really like to see this office with you in the boss's chair.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Don't even... [getting really happy and excited] EEEHHHH!!!!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You in the boss's chair!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: EEEHHH!! No. Hehe.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: In my family, you don't really go out and get things. If you want something, you write it on a list, and then the housekeeper goes out and gets it, on Wednesdays and Fridays. So, I don't know, I guess you could say this job is on my list, and... [awkwardly smiling] we'll see what Rosa comes back with.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [checks to see that she is alone with Phyllis] Did you hear anything?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sure they'll let us know when they get the results. [Erin crosses fingers and smiles excitedly]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It turns out that Erin was born in the basic time and region that I gave away a child.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: So, Phyllis might be my mom. I mean, the chances are tiny, but...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: But, probably not, I mean, it was a big year for babies. Porky's had come out.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah. I'm sure I was just another Porky's baby.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Mm.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: But why not find out.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Dwight, who is reading the want ads] Should you really be so blatant about that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They won't make me manager, and I won't settle for anything less. I've gone about as far as I can here. That's obvious. Time to take my talents elsewhere.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you really going to apply for work at Scranton Breadworks?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Bread is the paper of the food industry. You write your sandwich on it.

Quote.Speaker: Warren Buffett
Quote.Text: Can you do any better on salary?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Unfortunately, that range is set at corporate.

Quote.Speaker: Warren
Quote.Text: What about mileage when I use my car? I mean, gas ain't cheap, you know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Heh. We think that 25 cents a mile is pretty generous.

Quote.Speaker: Warren
Quote.Text: How about 27? And uh, when I make long-distance calls, will they be monitored or is it on the honor system?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [on phone] Okay. [hangs up, smiling] How odd, a very unusual phone call from the Senator's office. The Senator wants me to have lunch with him at The Botanical Gardens.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: The Botanical Gardens, Scranton's hidden gem. Don't eat any berries you don't recognize.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: How will your experience selling refinery equipment translate to our smaller scale here?

Quote.Speaker: Robert California
Quote.Text: You don't work in sales, do you.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Uh... Human Resources.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: You see, I sit across from a man. I see his face. I see his eyes. Now, does it matter if he wants a hundred dollars of paper or a hundred million dollars of deep-sea drilling equipment? Don't be a fool. He wants respect. He wants love. He wants to be younger. He wants to be attractive. There is no such thing as a product. Don't ever think there is. There is only... sex. Everything... is sex. You understand that what I'm telling you is a universal truth,... Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Okay, I-I am, I'm almost a little concerned that you might be overqualified for the position. [Robert and Gabe chuckle at this, then Gabe stops chuckling] Do you, um, do you think that you are?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Do I look like someone who would waste my own time?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: No. [Robert then nods his head at Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can you... [seems intimidated, clears throat] You are a man of great confidence. Could you speak a little more to that, and, what the role of confidence... would be... in a dialogue with a subordinate?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Will you be heard? Will you have a voice? Will I steamroll over you? Do you feel heard right now, Jim? Do you have a voice, right now? You can answer me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: That was your choice, not mine. The fallacy is that it is up to the steamroller. It is up to the object... whether it will be flattened or not, and I can tell from the small interaction we've had already, you won't be flattened by anybody. Do you agree with me, Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [more emphatically than Jim] Yes. You do. [nods at the Search Committee, then looks over at the camera with a smirk on his face]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Robert leaves the conference room and looks at the others in the office as he grins at the camera and leaves] He creeps me out. [Toby nods] But, I think he might be a genius.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Jim points at Darryl to be the next interviewee] Good luck, Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [pats Andy on the back] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Think about it! What other mammal, besides humans, drinks the milk of another mammal? I mean, you don't see a bear drinking raccoon milk.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Jim and Gabe laugh, Toby smiles and nods] Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: So this is cool. I think we make a good fit. [stands up]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Oh? Uh... we haven't started the interview yet. Were you-were you joking?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Uh... [looks at camera] yes?! I was. [sits back down] Little joke!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: So, how would you go about settling interpersonal conflicts within the office?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I thought that was your job.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, it's one of my strengths, but it's the manager's job.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, for instance, how did you deal with it when two warehouse guys got into a fight?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'll answer that, Jim. I would use it as an opportunity to teach, uh, about actions... and consequences... of actions. [Jim and Gabe stare at Darryl]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [noticing Erin in the background leading a black man dressed in a suit through the office] Who's that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [ignoring Darryl's question] So I think all we need is a resume, and we'll be good right?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I... I just thought you knew me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, it's no big deal, just something that looks like that. [shows Darryl a resume] Cool? [goes to put the resume away]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Let me... [Jim shows him the resume again, Darryl looks at it a little longer this time] Oh. Cool. [Jim gives Darryl a thumbs-up, then looks at the camera as Darryl gets up to leave]

Quote.Speaker: Merv Bronte
Quote.Text: [at the cafe on the first floor] Did, uh, you just interview?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Ohh, unfortunately, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Merv
Quote.Text: What do you mean?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: That business can't attract anyone. It's awful up there. Those people seem like they're in prison, waiting out life sentences in a... dying industry.

Quote.Speaker: Merv
Quote.Text: Place must be horrible. I don't know if I want this job. [gets on elevator]

Quote.Speaker: Merv
Quote.Text: [in elevator] Well, if I get this job offer, and then I know that I'm gonna take it, and if I take it, I know that I'm never gonna quit, and then 25 years are gonna go by and... I'm gonna die here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What makes you feel qualified to judge a place after a mere interview? [Robert stares at Dwight] What are you doing..? [Dwight sits up abruptly] Stop trying to figure me out.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I just did.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You can't.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: It's done.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, it's not.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I know you now, your nature. I'm done. Not worth continuing. [at the same time, Dwight says:

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm gonna prevent inferior men from sullying my place of work with their weak, passionless leadership. Do you see my hat? No? That's because I just threw it in the ring.

Quote.Speaker: Merv
Quote.Text: You guys pay for relocation, though, right?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, why would you need relocation, if you already live in Scranton?

Quote.Speaker: Merv
Quote.Text: Well, I'd want to move further away, you know? Just... I don't want any chance to run into my co-workers outside the office.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can I ask why you're leaving your current job?

Quote.Speaker: Merv
Quote.Text: [pulls out a tupperware from his briefcase and takes out a tupperware] I'm leaving my other job because they were all jerks, really. [opens tupperware] You know, all of 'em. You had your jerk-wads, and your jerk-offs, so, just between the wads and the offs, I just... I had to get outta there. [begins eating sandwich]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is this a bad time to be doing this?

Quote.Speaker: Merv
Quote.Text: I'm having a bad time. [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, if we did something to upset you, I'm sure it was inadvertent.

Quote.Speaker: Merv
Quote.Text: [continues to chew, slower and slower, appears confused] Wait.

Quote.Speaker: Merv
Quote.Text: Oh, why did I believe that weirdo in the lobby? These are the nicest people I ever met.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [limo driver lets Angela out of the limo at the office parking lot] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [looking at an engagement ring on Angela's finger] It's gorgeous, Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, I actually know about nice rings and it is gorgeous.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [looks at ring, whispering] Wow...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's a little flashy. I mean, what am I? Naomi Judd?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Tell us the freaking story!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah! Tell us a story.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay. He took me to the replica of Monet's Japanese bridge, and then he put this flower behind my ear, which normally, I would hate, 'cause it's so civil rightsy. Then he got down on one knee, and he said, will you be a Senator's wife?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughing] Oh-ho-ho! He talked about himself in the third person?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes, Pam. Not everyone is as informal as you and Jim. [imitating Jim's voice] Oh, hey Pam, dude, whatever, wanna marry me? [Erin, Kelly, and Meredith laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's not accurate.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Then I saw flashes. Reporters were there. They always find us. And everyone was crying, even his aide. [camera pans and shows Oscar in disbelief]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Angela's engaged to a gay man. As a gay man, I'm horrified. As a friend of Angela's, horrified. As a lover of elegant weddings, [smiles] I'm a little excited. [expression becomes serious again] But overall, horrified.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Andy? You all set?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay, guys, it's time. It's pep talk time. Tell me what I need to hear.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Are you sure this is a good idea? I hate to see you disappointed.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [grunts] Augh.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I think Andy should be the boss. He's just so great. If I'm being objective, then Darryl, of course.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, Andy, what improvements would you make as office manager?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: For starters, I really think we can streamline communication around here... [gets cut off by Gabe]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Whoa! That's a very heavy accusation to level against Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I wasn't acc-, accusing...

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Well, Toby's in charge of Human Resources, that would include communication. I think that Toby's done a fine job.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Right! I really wasn't trying to insult any, anyone.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I didn't think you were.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I have two relationships with Andy. I have a personal relationship, and I have a professional relationship. Personally, yeah, I think he's a rat, and I think he's responsible for the demise of my relationship with Erin. Professionally,... he broke up the happiest couple in this office!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: How many windows are there in New York City?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Critical thinking. Common, on-the-spot question asked in an interview.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay. Let me think... are you counting car windows?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: No... How far away is the Sun?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [happily] Uh, 93 million miles.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Gabe] Is it?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah! And the diameter of the Sun is 870,000 miles, which makes it 109 times wider than the Earth, and... [Gabe looks visibily annoyed] 333,000 times heavier than the Earth,...

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Shut up about the Sun! SHUT UP about the SUN! [slams fist, hurting his hand]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [alone in his car] I am unhappy with the confusing and, at times, confrontational nature of that meeting. I wanted it to go better. I WANTED IT TO GO BETTER!!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [on phone] Yes, there used to be a paper clip that would pop up and say "Looks like you are writing a letter or resume. Would you like help? I believe his name was... [looks embarrassed at camera] Clippy.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [on phone] First of all, I want to thank you for your years of patronizing our company. I've got some bad news. We're going out of business. [covers phone, whispers to Pam] Saving face. [uncovers phone] Yep, yep. I understand that. Basically everything is falling apart here. Pam looks around the office and realizes only she has overheard this]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How is this on me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hang up. [Creed hangs up] Corporate needs you to find the differences between this picture and this picture. [shows Creed two similar-looking photos of some building] Intel has told us there were at least seven.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [takes the pictures] Okay I already see one, gimme. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: They're the same picture.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well, I manage my department, and I've been doing that for several years now. And, god, I've learned a lot of life lessons along the way.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Your department's just you, right?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yes, Jim, but I am not easy to manage.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Great! [to Jim and Toby] Um, can we just... [does a "wrap it up" motion with his pen]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What was that?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: We just have a lot of serious candidates to get through today, so... [nods]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [getting upset] Am I not a serious candidate?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: What do you want me to say? I mean, there's a line of qualified people out there. We have a video CV from England. [to Jim and Toby] Are we all just gonna pretend to- okay. [to Kelly] Um, what are your weaknesses?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I don't have any, assh***.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [comes in, slapping some papers on the table] I want an interview.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [walking with Jim in the parking lot] How's the family?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good. They good?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's your daughter's name again? Peepee?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Peepa.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Peepa, how is she?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Great! Oh, that's great... We never were very good at small talk, were we, Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Now, listen,...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're not getting an interview, Dwight. The whole point of this Search Committee process is to prevent hiring someone like you ever again.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, I know why you're saying that, Jim, I really do, but think of it this way. The hand that reaches from the grave to grip your throat [motions to grip Jim's throat] is the strong hand you want on the wheel.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [pulls Dwight's arm down] Okay. That's vivid.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm going to make you an offer. Okay? You even do so little as grant me an interview, I will guarantee you your dream work life. Okay? You roll in at 10 a.m. to your own private reserved parking spot, pick up your daily free coffee from Dwight's Caffeine Corner, unlimited sex breaks for you and Pam...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yikes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Erin will eat garbage for your entertainment.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, you know how I like taking bribes. [both smile]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ha ha! [pats Jim on the back]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Unfortunately, Jo also took the job away from you because she doesn't trust your judgment. So how would that look for me, if I recommended you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fine. I'll do it without you, but you'll regret this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let me get that for you. [runs ahead to open the door for Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. [looks ashamed]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Pam... I think Robert is gay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The Senator? [Oscar nods] He was married before, and he has a kid.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [whispers] So!?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And don't say that thing about how lots of gay guys have kids.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I have a very strong suspicion.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Did you see him at a bathhouse?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What bathhouse?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The windowless building by the Baskin Robbins.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [confused, whispers] What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Forget it. I'm never gonna know what goes on there.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: My friend at the Scranton Blade is totally plugged into these matters.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're in the gay mafia.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You're thinking of another group. Much wealthier, much older. [whispers, smiles] You sound ignorant.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You guys, um, talking Senator?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No. Why would we be talking about the Senator?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: 'Cause he's totally gay? [walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Um, how do I know that Robert is gay? He "liked" my facebook photos at 3 o'clock in the morning.

Quote.Speaker: David Brent
Quote.Text: [on video resume on a laptop] Name? David Brent. Occupation? Inspirer. Status? None of your business. Young, free, and single, though. Thanks for asking. Hear you're looking for a new boss. Yeah? Someone to tell a bunch of discontented, underencouraged drones what to do every day. Is that it? Oh. Our out-of-touch powers that be? Want me to fire them, if they don't see things your way? Then I ain't that dude. Bye-bye, baby, bye-bye. Get some other corporate suit to lay down the law. What? You've changed your mind? You're now looking for a leader of men? Ipso facto, women too. [points at self] When do I start? Yeah. [Jim looks uninterested in this candidate]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Do you know what it took to get Bob to notice me? I waited in his office every morning wearing nothing but kitty-cat ears. I did that every day for two weeks. And on the tenth day he walked in, he was naked too, except a dog nose. Guess what we did then?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [trying to cut off Phyllis] I... I don't think I can do that.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Bestiality. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, that's not my personality.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: If my daughter were asking me... [both giggle]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I would say, if you want someone, if you really want them,... go get them.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I do really want him.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: So, uh... here you go. [gives resume to Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hope it's all right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm sure it's fine.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: The guy who was in here earlier, interviewed after me, how'd he do?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Howard Cline?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Ehh, that's not who I'm talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [checks sheet] Oh... Deshaun Williams.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yes. How did he do?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He's an amazing man. He's a Rhodes Scholar. He invented an app that invents apps. Fantastic kisser...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Come on man. I'm being serious. Don't joke.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Darryl! We all know you. Your interview is not nearly as important as the other guys. [Darryl taps a couple times on Jim's desk and walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie Bertram
Quote.Text: First, I'll take down the cubicle walls.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: But there aren't...

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Symbol of transparency. There'd be no titles. Everyone would have the same job. Same goes for me. I'd take your job, but I'd reject the title.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: A little un-specific.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Everyone would be known for their accomplishments.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's very interesting. Um, I feel like there might be a conflict there, and if a conflict did arise, how would that be dealt with?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Ooh? Yeah. Mm. Scratch everything from before. I tell you what I'd do. Go the other way. More cubicles. More division. Everyone is somebody's boss, and that person can fire the person below them. [overlapping comments by the Search Committee] At least once a month, the lowest performing person... [does a cut-throat hand gesture] bye bye!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: How would you compare, like, an accountant and HR?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Well, I'll tell you how. Shall I? I'll tell you how.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: By splitting the difference. Just... just, somewhere in the middle.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think that's probably all we need to hear from...

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Zen office. Hmm? Thought of that? That's what I'd do. Everyone takes their shoes off, before they come in. Okay. There'd be no desks. You just sit on the floor.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's very...

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: You've got a Thai woman, out in the back. Sockee! Sockee!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Okay, that's not gonna be...

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Sockee!... is her name. Okay? Shes administering massage, all right, if you need it. If you don't, whatever, just talk to her! She's a person! Either way, 50 minutes of that and you...you are cracking to go. [smiles]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Is there a front runner?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what? They all just sort of blend together after a while.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Well, there must be someone who stands out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, not at all. In fact, I'm not even taking it seriously. I think at the end of the day, I'm just gonna pick a name out of the hat.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: The hell you will! I worked for the last boss for 15 years. According to my doctor, I don't have another 15 years if I want to keep up the same dietary and sexual lifestyle, which I intend to.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [in mock seriousness] Oh no, Stanley... you'll live forever...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: My next boss will be my last boss. He'll be at my funeral. So I would appreciate it if you would take this seriously. [dunks his half-eaten donut in Jim's coffee, takes it back out, and leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh-

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You pick a crappy boss, you're responsible for my crappy life. [leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, everybody, I was just making a joke. I am taking it seriously, I promise.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Are you? [leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Little advice? Take a day off from the whole Jim schtick. Try caring about something. You might like how it feels... James. [closes his office door, leaving Jim alone in the break room]

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: [walks in with her dogs] Gabe, honey! Oh, lord. Take all this. [gives the dog leashes and multiple bags to Gabe]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Here. Jim! Did you hear Stern this morning?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, was it good?

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Ohh, Robin was good. She's always good. Keeps him on his toes. Its Howard's show though. [picks up resume from Jim's desk] Whose is this? Darryl Philbin. Ohh. Very nice to see a familiar face on top. Ah... a little long aren't we? Four pages? Is this the same Darryl Philbin who's had two jobs in ten years at one company?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yes, thanks to you, who promoted me, after we, uh, interfaced.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Coordinated and implemented receipt storage and delivery of over 2.5 billion units of inventory. 2.5 billion, Darryl? 2.5 billion units of what?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Paper material, ma'am.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Paper material?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [softly] Pieces of paper. [Jo rolls her eyes]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [clears throat] Jo, may I speak to you for a second?

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Or what? You gonna shoot me?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ha ha ha! Ha ha ha! Ohh, I enjoy laughing at my mistakes, because I've learned so much from them. I'd like to be interviewed for the position.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: I'll interview you right now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Question 1. Ever shot a gun in the office?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's complicated.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Yeah, but see... it's not.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I don't think we should tell her. Angela went a whole day without telling me I had lettuce in my teeth. Screw her.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm a woman. I would want to know.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yeah, you gotta know.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Okay, but if Angela can get a gay man to marry her, maybe I could get a lesbian to marry me? Huh? Huh? That's hot.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You have met a lesbian in real life, right?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You know, this is probably is her last chance at a family.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: She does seem happy.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You're right. You're right. She seems happy. We don't tell her.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: We don't tell her.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Excuse me, Ms. Bennett, may I have a word?

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Uh,... can it be in private? [to Gabe] Don't worry, it's not about you. [Gabe smiles and leaves] As Minority Executive, I think it's my responsibility to let you know that Gabe is gross. I don't think it's professional that he was sleeping with the receptionist, and then when Erin dumped him, so that she could be with Andy, he became a total crazy stalker psycho.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Welcome to Scranton, Jo. Land of a thousand problems only you can fix. [Jo's phone starts vibrating, she picks it up and sees Dwight has texted her "Dwight's ability as a manager has lead him to higher levels of proffesional success,"] Oh for god's sake. He's texting me his resume one line at a time. These are costing me ten cents a piece, you jackass! I'm roaming!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [to Jordan] Get me our biggest client on the phone, right this instant. [closes his office door]

Quote.Speaker: Jordan
Quote.Text: Who is our biggest client?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, just put him through to me.

Quote.Speaker: Jordan
Quote.Text: [laughs] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hello! This is... the client.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: It's Creed. FYI, I'm starting my own paper company, looking to poach some chumps, you in?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Hehehe, cool. Let's keep this on the QT, okay? I uh, I don't want you to be a dead mamma jamma.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: All right, thank you, bye-bye.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you, bye-bye.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [knocks and enters] Jo, you have one more candidate. He's a burn victim.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Huh?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [motions toward her face] He's all messed up. I can tell him to get lost if you want.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: No, send him in. [to Search Committee] Who is this?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I have no idea.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [seeing Dwight wearing sunglasses and whose face and hands are completely covered in gauze] Oh, I know this guy. [Dwight awkwardly hands copies of his resume to the Search Committee] Hello! Mr. "Soo-ven-yay." Mr. "Jacques Soo-ven-yay." Nice to meet you. It says here you're French. [Dwight nods] So you worked at your last job for 15 years as Assistant to the Regional Manager.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [mumbling through the gauze] Assistant Regional Manager.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Assistant to the Regional Manager.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [again] Assistant Regional Manager.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What is it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [in a cheesy French accent] Assistant Regional Manager.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, that's my mistake, sorry about that. The last paper company you worked for burned to the ground? And all because they wouldn't hire a manager who lived and breathed paper? That's a travesty.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: I want to talk to Dwight Schrute for a second. I want to ask him a question. [Gabe gets up to leave] If he isn't here in sixty seconds...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uhh. Wait. Wait! No. Stop! Stop. Jo... [takes off sunglasses and reveals his face] It's me. I'm Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [looks extremely confused] No. No! Wait, but, I mean, you're Dwight, and then... he's the... [trails off]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [whispers] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [looks astonished] Ohhhh!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Very unprofessional, "Jacques." Or, should I say, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Let's just say I had hired this Jack Souvenir. Then what?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I would have dressed this way every day, legally changed my name, learned French sign language, shown up, and been the best damn branch manager you'd ever seen!

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: All that for this job.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: That's f***ing crazy. [Jo and Dwight both smile] Get outta here. [Dwight leaves] What a nutjob.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This guy was good. Although, he did keep saying that he needed two weeks off right at the beginning for a trip to the finger lakes. Seriously. Every five minutes, he was like, "just making sure the finger lakes thing is clear."

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Okay, it's fun to talk about the rejects, but uh, who's got ya excited?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Finger Lakes guy is good. Darryl is also very good.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Who's this fella? Went to Cornell. What's wrong with him?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: How much time do you have? Sales ability? None. Integrity? See sales ability. [makes a "zero" hand gesture]

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: And that's your unbiased opinion.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yes, it is.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: So it's not relevant that he took the receptionist away from you?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Oh, Jo. Jo, I'm disappointed in you. Some people let personal things into the workpl-. Is she with him? Because I thought that she was...

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Gabe...ugh... you got all close to these people. Got involved in their lives. Let's get you back to Florida. We'll figure out something for you.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: That sounds like a promotion!

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: It's not. Let's get Kelly in here to take his place.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um... why Kelly?

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: 'Cause Gabe's tall and weak. She's short and strong. I'm doing an opposites thing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: How'd my girl Nellie do?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I didn't know you knew her?

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: She didn't mention it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Integrity move. I like it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know, she also gave me a reason to think that maybe she wasn't a good fit.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Well, I'm not saying you must hire her. If you find someone who's clearly a fit, then fine. Just make sure they fit real good. No more manager turnover. Don't mess this up, Jim. And give Dwight an interview. I like a little bit of crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [hiding under desk, raises a sock puppet up, talking in high-pitched voice] Ahh!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Erin, what are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I've been turned into a puppet!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Okay. [walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [giggling, walks to Erin's desk] Look at the puppet! Hi, puppet! Who are you?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I went to drop off the FedEx forms and an evil witch named Angela turned me into a puppet!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [giggles] Yeah. Low blow, puppet.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: And there's only one thing that can change me back into a real girl.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It's good. It's just that I wish the puppets would talk more about the alphabet. Not for me... but, if any kids are watching... A, B, and so forth. You know,... M-N-L-O, P... F...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [as sock puppet] I need the most special thing in the office.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Silence?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: A date with the best salesman... Andy Bernard! [Andy walks over to Erin's desk]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [gets up] Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Where'd you learn how to puppet like that?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [shrugs] I've done it all my life.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Listen, I'm really flattered, but I don't think we should.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Erin's my best friend in this office, hands down, but... when she asked me out, I just didn't have that feeling, you know? [clip jumps ahead] Aren't there some things that you really want to like, but you just can't... seem to like it, like, Mad Men... or football... [clips jumps ahead] Let's not forget, Erin chose Gabe over me. That happened. I'm not going to apologize for getting over her, okay? I'm sorry. [clip jumps ahead] I would go for someone who's more... she's great, though.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [loudly] Stanley, I won't be able to invite everyone to the wedding, because we want to keep it to 350.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'll get over it.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I mean, we just have to see how many Senators and members of Congress want to attend, before we can open it up to regular people. Pam, you know how you and Jim did your ironic wedding? [Pam looks confused] Do you still have the plans for the dream wedding that you couldn't afford?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That was our dream wedding.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Niagara Falls? Pregnant? That was your dream? Pork medallions?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [looks over at Oscar, who is quietly watching this happen] I hope... you have a very beautiful wedding, Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right. Name.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dwight Schrute.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you, Mr. Schnoot. [closes his binder] We will let you know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You have to interview me...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I just did. The answer to that one question told me everything I need to know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I demand more questions!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [ignoring Dwight] All right, guys, good day, a lot of candidates. Let's discuss.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay! If you're not going to interview me, then I'll do it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What will be your first priority? I will have seven first priorities. Safety, profits, fostering a community of self-reliance and entrepreneurship, listening, respect for human life, bolstering our public image, and... [chuckles] getting everyone home on time. Dwight, let me be frank. In an accident that no one can blame you for, an antique gun was discharged while you were acting manager. How are we ever to trust you again? [whispering] That's a great question. [Jim nods] I am going to institute a strict no-firearms policy for this office that extends to myself as well. Wow. All of my concerns are disappearing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you. [clears throat and gets up] You'll be hearing from us shortly, Mr. Schrute, and I think you're gonna like the call you're going to receive. [smiles] Oh, come on. I'm just happy that I got this meeting. [leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, that was quick.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [sighs] Very, very interesting. And you know what? I'm impressed.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He's not a real candidate.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I don't know, Jim, 'cause, makes me think about something my grandfather used to say, which is that, sometimes, the hand that jumps out of the grave and grabs you around the throat; that is the hand that you want on the wheel.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You took the deal.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, it was a great deal.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's not okay.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I don't know. Dwight seems like a great leader to me, and I look forward to the personal perks that he promised me privately. What do you think, Toby?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, we could try him out for a little while... [Jim drops his pen, looks exasperated] and if it doesn't work out, you know, maybe one of us could, you know, step in...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What is happening right now?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Is it true that you're making Dwight the manager?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, why would you think that?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: He and Kelly said, then they pre-fired me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. [walks out of conference room] Okay, guys, just so you all know, no decision has been made, and Dwight is definitely not the boss.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: That is correct. Actually, Dwight is not the manager yet.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no, no. Not ever, 'cause that's not gonna happen.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, it's not entirely up to you, is it? Seems to me like someone's getting a little power-mad.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Am I the only one who remembers what he did when he was in charge? I feel like I'm going a little bit crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Tuna... You're completely sane.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Who do you like for the job? Is there anyone who maybe was a little underwhelming at first, but now seems like a safe, if not slightly unexciting, choice?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, seems like everybody has an opinion. So, who else? Anybody?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Do you mean it? Anybody? Are you sure?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [while sighing] I suppose I am.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Okay... well what do 'I' want in a manager?... let me see. [walks slowly across the office] what do 'I' want?...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I don't think he meant, that-

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: So now anyone gets to talk at any times?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What do 'I' want?... I'm looking for someone... who... [smiles] Everyone is listening to me. [Dwight looks at the camera, annoyed]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Can I say...?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I think it should be Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What a surprise! Minorities sticking together.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Kelly's on your side.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, is that all you think of me? A minority? I am so much more than that. I am a dancer, I'm a singer, I'm a fashion designer.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoever it is, I think they should be lame. [Stanley shakes his head and rolls his eyes] Kind a a non-threatening, moderate personality.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I want an outsider.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Perfect. There are several outside candidates that we think would be really-

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, I mean an outsider. Like someone on the margins of society, who doesn't see things the way we do, like a homeless person.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: A homeless person. Really? A homeless person.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, you're right, Pam, let's just leave him to the welfare system and let that handle it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I want you to say that you think the 'best' person to be our new manager is a homeless person.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Let me guess who you want, Pam. Rachael Ray? The ladies of The View?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I got away with... everything, under the last boss, and it wasn't good for me, at all. So, I want guidance. I want leadership. But don't just, like, boss me around, you know? Like, lead me. Lead me... when I'm in the mood... to be led.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I just want, for once, a smart, professional, decisive, well-hung man in his forties.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey! Hey! Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Okay, fine. Uhh, the guy with a tiny penis. Are you happy? [sarcastically] Let's hire that guy! [Jim looks speechless]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: She may have a point there... would a small penis work? Small-to-moderate.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [walks in] Gotta catch a plane.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ohh, hey Gabe, I'm sorry, we... we didn't get you a cake or anything. We're gonna miss you.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Oh, well I'm still the corporate liaison to the branch.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You are not leaving without giving me a hug. [hugs Gabe] Ughh.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Okay, you know what, you don't need to make that sound.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I'm sorry! You were just a lot bonier than I thought you were gonna be!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: There are plenty of people who love touching me. [camera zooms to Ryan, who looks at the camera, extremely skeptical] I'm a terrific hugger. I've been with a bunch of girls where that's basically all they want to do. I will see you all soon.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Later, man.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: [various] Good luck! Goodbye! Good luck at your new job.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Take care, man.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We're gonna miss you, Gabe. [Gabe leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [stands up] Uh, listen up. Listen up, ladies. I want the job. There, I said it. I'm educated. I'm capable. I like all of you... and I won't make any changes.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I see it. [nods and smiles] I see it like I see a mountain that I'm standing in front of [voice cracks] and facing, and I'm like...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah. [Oscar looks confused] Yeah, Andy would be wonderful as boss. Erin made a good point. [brushes Erin's hair with her hand]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No, we're not related. I got the call. But... I'll tell her some other day. [smiles]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What about Darryl? We can all agree that he's a stand-up guy, right?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, let me be clear. I only speak for myself, and not myself and the Senator. I think we have some wonderful candidates, and there's a great, lively debate here, but let's think about-

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No, no,... no. Sorry. We cut Kevin off for the same thing. You have to have something to say, if you talk. [Angela rolls her eyes and stops talking]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Exactly.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [enters the office with his daughter, who runs in and hugs Jim] Jada, no, no, no, Jada, what are you doing? [Jim looks knowingly at the camera] Oh. So sorry, guys. I hope my family didn't disrupt your meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: Daddy, are these the people who are making you manager?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [sighs] Maybe, sweetheart. Single dad. Challenges.

Quote.Speaker: Jada
Quote.Text: I don't know if he'd be a good manager [Jim shakes his head and looks wide-eyed at Darryl], but he's a really great dad!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Okay, shush it. This was a mistake. Let's go. [Darryl and Jada leave, Ryan slowly shakes his head]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It seems like we all know enough to vote. Should we just vote now?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What? No, no, it's not a vote.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Then what was this all about?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know. This conversation really got away from me.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I don't care. They can just vote.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, they can't. That's not how this is gonna work. [exhales] We're going in this room, we're going to have a meeting. We're gonna make a recommendation to Jo, and she's gonna give you her recommendation on Monday. Okay? [to Kelly and Toby, as they re-enter the conference room] What the hell happened out there? [Kevin tries to follow, but the door is closed on him]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sometimes you hear about people failing upwards. I think I'm about to do that.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: This job? Oh, yeah, I'll get it. Jo's an old friend. I think... I'm her best friend. She's not my best friend.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Every day I have a blueberry muffin. Today, I did not have a blueberry muffin. Should have had the blueberry muffin... especially considering how incredibly superstitious I am.

Quote.Speaker: Fred
Quote.Text: No, I've never been more sure of anything in my life. I will be the new boss of... [looks back to glance at lobby directory] Vance Refrigeration.

Quote.Speaker: Merv
Quote.Text: Honestly, I think I... I sabotaged myself. It's like I'm afraid of being happy. Case in point... I was supposed to start another job today.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [chuckles] I will get offered the job. That's a... call I've received many times. The slight hopefulness in their voice, the pregnant pause... while they wait to hear my response, and then... my response.

Quote.Speaker: Finger Lakes Guy
Quote.Text: [geeky voice] I want the job. I really do. It's just, the rest of my family's in the Finger Lakes right now. I'm supposed to be in the Finger Lakes right now. I told them I was on a hike; snuck away to do this interview. I gotta get back pretty soon; they'll worry. People disappear in the Finger Lakes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I will run this branch, or I will destroy this branch, or... [shrugs] I don't know. Something always works out. [leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: You remind me so much of my fourth-biggest client.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [in high-pitched, damsel-like voice] Is that right?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I think you two should meet.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, okay!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Hey Jordana! Patch my ninth- and fourth-biggest clients together. [Pam puts down phone and picks it back up]

Quote.Speaker: Pam as "fourth-biggest client"
Quote.Text: [in a comedic male voice] Hello!

Quote.Speaker: Pam as "ninth-biggest client"
Quote.Text: [in high-pitched, damsel-like voice] Hello!

Quote.Speaker: Pam as "fourth-biggest client"
Quote.Text: Hi, how are ya? [Erin looks amused, Stanley and Phyllis look at Pam, confused]

Quote.Speaker: Pam as "ninth-biggest client"
Quote.Text: Ohho! I'm good! Don't you just love paper, and things about paper!

Quote.Speaker: Pam as "fourth-biggest client"
Quote.Text: Hey, are you single? This seems like a love connection to me!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: It's Kismet!
